intro: Epacris impressa var. speciosa, commonly known as the Heath Myrtle or the Mountain Heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms and aromatic foliage.
